RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduaчуo em Engenharia Mecтnica pela UFPE (1998). Foi Professor Substituto no Departamento de Engenharia Mecтnica da UFPE entre 1998-2000 (Сrea de Fabricaчуo-Usinagem). Possui mestrado em Engenharia Mecтnica pela UFPE (2001) e doutorado em Engenharia Civil pela UFPE (2005). Foi Bolsista de Pѓs-Doutorado Jњnior no DECIV-UFPE (2005-2006). Pesquisador de Pѓs-Doutorado (bolsista de DCR) no Nњcleo de Tecnologia do Centro Acadъmico do Agreste da Universidade Federal de Pernambuco (UFPE) no perэodo de (2006-2008). Pesquisador de Pѓs-Doutorado (PRODOC) no Departamento de Engenharia Mecтnica da UFPE (2008-2010). Atualmente, щ Professor Associado IV na сrea de Energia no Departamento de Engenharia Mecтnica da UFPE e щ Prof. Permanente nos Programas de Pѓs Graduaчуo de Engenharia Civil (PPGEC-UFPE) e de Engenharia Mecтnica (PPGEM-UFPE). Foi Vice-Coordenador do PPGEM-UFPE (2018-2020 e 2020-2022). Atualmente щ Coordenador do PPGEM-UFPE (2024-) e Coordenador da Сrea de Simulaчуo Computacional e Modelagem Aplicadas e Petrѓleo e Meio Ambiente do PPGEC-UFPE (2023-). Membro das Comissѕes de Autoavaliaчуo e de Credenciamento e Recredenciamento Docente do PPGEC-UFPE e PPGEM-UFPE e membro do NDE do curso de Engenharia Mecтnica da UFPE. Tambщm щ Bolsista de Produtividade em Pesquisa do CNPq Nэvel 1D (PQ-1D) a partir de 03/2022. Eleito por 3 vezes consecutivas como 1o Secretсrio Executivo da Associaчуo Brasileira de Mщtodos Computacionais em Engenharia (ABMEC) para os perэodos de 01/2021 atщ 12/2022 e 01/2023 atщ 12/2024 e de 01/2025-. Tem experiъncia nas сreas de Engenharia Civil e Engenharia Mecтnica, com ъnfase em Princэpios Variacionais e Mщtodos Numщricos, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: Formulaчѕes Numщricas Localmente Conservativas em Malhas Nуo-Estruturadas, Mщtodos de Alta Ordem e Verdadeiramente Multidimensionais, Mщtodos de Linhas de Fluxo (Streamlines), Modelagem e Simulaчуo de Escoamentos em meios porosos, Mщtodo dos Volumes Finitos Multiescala, Simulaчуo de Reservatѓrios de Petrѓleo, Reservatѓrios Carbonсticos e Naturalmente Fraturados, Geomecтnica Computacional, Geraчуo e Adaptaчуo automсtica de malhas nуo-estruturadas, Mщtodo dos Volumes Finitos em malhas nуo-estruturadas e Biotransferъncia de calor e Modelagem e Simulaчуo Computacional do Escoamento Multifсsico e Multicomponente em Dutos de Petroleo.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: He holds a degree in Mechanical Engineering from UFPE (1998). He served as a Substitute Professor in the Department of Mechanical Engineering at UFPE from 1998 to 2000 (Manufacturing-Machining Area). He has a master's degree in Mechanical Engineering from UFPE (2001) and a Ph.D. in Civil Engineering from UFPE (2005). He was a Junior Post-Doctoral Fellow at DECIV-UFPE (2005-2006). He was a Post-Doctoral Researcher (DCR fellow) at the Technology Center of the Academic Center of Agreste at the Federal University of Pernambuco (UFPE) from (2006-2008). He was a Post-Doctoral Researcher (PRODOC) in the Department of Mechanical Engineering at UFPE (2008-2010). Currently, he is an Associate Professor III in the Energy area at the Department of Mechanical Engineering at UFPE and a Permanent Professor in the Graduate Programs of Civil Engineering (PPGEC-UFPE) and Mechanical Engineering (PPGEM-UFPE). He was the Vice-Coordinator of PPGEM-UFPE (2018-2020 and 2020-2022). He is currently the Coordinator of PPGEM-UFPE (2024-) and Coordinator of the Computational Simulation and Applied Modeling in Oil and Environment area of PPGEC-UFPE (2023-204). He is a member of the Self-Assessment and Faculty Accreditation and Reaccreditation Commissions of PPGEC-UFPE and PPGEM-UFPE and a member of the NDE of the Mechanical Engineering course at UFPE. He is also a CNPq Productivity Fellow Level 1D (PQ-1D) since 03/2022. He was elected as the 1st Executive Secretary of the Brazilian Association of Computational Methods in Engineering (ABMEC) for the periods from 01/2021 to 12/2022 and from 01/2023 to 12/2024. He has experience in the areas of Civil Engineering and Mechanical Engineering, with an emphasis on Variational Principles and Numerical Methods, mainly working on the following topics: Locally Conservative Numerical Formulations in Unstructured Meshes, High Order and Truly Multidimensional Methods, Streamline Methods, Modeling and Simulation of Flow in Porous Media, Multiscale Finite Volume Method, Simulation of Oil Reservoirs, Carbonate and Naturally Fractured Reservoirs, Computational Geomechanics, Automatic Generation and Adaptation of Unstructured Meshes, Finite Volume Method in Unstructured Meshes, and Bioheatransfer.
